join_steps.comment: Join order transactions with customer metadata (region, loyalty score) using customer_id. A left join is used to retain all original order records.

insights: The merged data allows for analysis of total sales amount segmented by customer attributes such as region and loyalty score.
The analyst should convert 'order_date' and 'signup_date' to datetime objects for temporal analysis (e.g., calculating customer lifetime value or speed of purchase after sign up).
Reviewing null values in customer fields after the left join will reveal orders placed by customers not present in the customer data file.

applied_steps.comment: Join order transactions with customer metadata (region, loyalty score) using customer_id. A left join is used to retain all original order records.

combined_summary:
Rows: 5, Columns: 10

Column types: order_id:object, customer_id:object, product_id:object, order_date:object, total_amount:float64, status:object, name:object, region:object, signup_date:object, loyalty_score:int64

  order_id customer_id product_id  order_date      status        name region signup_date
0    O1001        C001       P050  2024-04-02     Shipped   Aditi Rao   West  2024-01-15
1    O1002        C002       P010  2024-04-05   Delivered  Ben Howard  North  2023-11-02
2    O1003        C003       P050  2024-04-06  Processing   Chloe Kim  South  2024-03-28
insights: Total amounts are highly variable (54.00 to 299.00). Investigate if this spread is product-driven or indicative of promotional effects.
Customer loyalty scores are generally high (mean 79.8, min 65). Leverage this engagement for upsell opportunities or referrals.
Monitor the 'Processing' status of order O1003 (dated 2024-04-06) to ensure timely fulfillment standards are being met.
Product P050 appears in 40% of the small sample. Prioritize inventory monitoring for P050, confirming its status as a popular item.
The data includes recent sign-ups (C003 on 2024-03-28). Analyze if conversion rates or average order value differ for new customers.
